fields.subtitle: Labyrinth for children
fields.name: Avonturendoolhof
fields.detail_text: Find your way out and listen to the talking statue for tips. Watch out for the fountains which aim waterjets at you. Only for children less than 1.50 meter tall.

fields.subtitle: A treasure lies beneath
fields.detail_text:
Straight down in free fall! In order to enter the mine of Baron 1898 you drop down 37.5 meter! A ride for real daredevils from 1.32 meter. Duration: 2 minutes.

≤ 17 waiting line: this waiting line is only accessible for people upto and including 17 years of age. There is no need to keep your distance. All seats are allocated and cannot be chosen. Groups can be separated.

Wheelchair access: via a dedicated path, to the right next to the exit from this attraction.
fields.name: Baron 1898
Fabula
fields.detail_text:
In Fabula you will see how a young grumpy bear and a fearless squirrel share the most wonderful, exciting and hilarious adventures together. During the 3D film you will experience different 4D effects, such as water, wind and scents. Duration of movie: 8 minutes.

Wheelchair access: via the usual entrance to this attraction. Follow the dedicated path until the half-way point and then use the bell at the wheelchair access point. An employee will then come to meet you.

fields.subtitle: Fool Uncle Gus!
fields.name: Catch the bugs!
fields.detail_text:
Max and Moritz have fun while shaking the tree.

Bugs fall down quickly!

They put the bugs in a paper bag and then sneaked the squirming insects into Uncle Guses bed.

fields.name: Max & Moritz
fields.detail_text: On the Max & Moritz double roller coaster, you and the whole family experience an exciting and crazy ride full of tricks. But be careful, you may encounter a little mischief from the boys along the way! Which track will you choose, Max or Moritz?

fields.subtitle: Travel around the world with Jokie & Jet
fields.detail_text: Get to know various cultures and party with all the Red Noses in the world. In this covered attraction for all ages everyone is cheerful! Duration: 8 minutes. Wheelchair access: to the right, next to the exit from this attraction.
fields.name: Carnaval Festival

fields.subtitle: Efteling's most authentic place
fields.detail_text: Board one of the swing rides or merry-go-rounds on this traditional Dutch village square. In the square you can also enjoy all sorts of Dutch treats.
fields.name: Anton Pieck Plein

fields.subtitle: A trip back in time
fields.detail_text: Drive at 6.5 km/h along flower beds and through granaries in unique themed cars and pickup trucks. Even the little ones can drive in this attraction. Duration: 6 minutes. Wheelchair access: via the exit of the attraction.
fields.name: De Oude Tufferbaan

fields.subtitle: A forbidden journey
fields.detail_text:
Step on board 'De Vliegende Hollander' watercoaster for an exciting and maybe wet adventure! Everyone from 1.20 meter tall is welcome. Do you dare?

Duration: almost 4 minutes.

≤ 17 waiting line: this waiting line is only accessible for people upto and including 17 years of age. There is no need to keep your distance. All seats are allocated and cannot be chosen. Groups can be separated.

Wheelchair access: via a dedicated path, to the right of the usual entrance to this attraction. Please use the bell at the wheelchair access point. An employee will then come to meet you.

Guests from 13 years of age who need guidance when entering and leaving attractions are currently not able to visit this attraction.
fields.name: De Vliegende Hollander

fields.subtitle: Visit this miniature world
fields.name: Diorama
fields.detail_text: You won't know where to look first in the smallest world within Efteling. Here you can see little trains ride through landscapes in which villages come to life. Everyone is welcome!

fields.subtitle: Dreaming with open eyes
fields.detail_text: In this enchanting world you dream with your eyes wide open. Fly around elves and trolls in this covered attraction for the whole family! Duration: 6 minutes.
fields.name: Droomvlucht

fields.subtitle: In the secret Wonder Depot
fields.name: Efteling Museum
fields.detail_text: In this secret warehouse of wonder you will find out all there is to know about the more than 60 year history of Efteling. Step inside and explore!

fields.subtitle: This Forbidden City carries many secrets
fields.detail_text: Take a boat ride through the Forbidden City! This attraction may be very frightening for small children, who therefore have to be accompanied by an adult. Duration: 8 minutes. Wheelchair access: to the right of the attraction entrance.
fields.name: Fata Morgana

fields.subtitle: Win a prize
fields.name: Game Gallery
fields.detail_text: An old-fashioned outdoor fairground. Pay to play games for a chance at winning terrific prizes. There is also a sweets shop. And there is a photo studio where you take lovely photos with a real Efteling background.

fields.subtitle: Get carried away
fields.name: Gondoletta
fields.detail_text:
Glide through a magical landscape and relax. The vegetation has been specially designed to naturally attract animals. Duration: 20 minutes. This attraction closes after sunset. Wheelchair access: report to the left of the exit from this attraction. An employee will then come to meet you.

Guests who need guidance when entering and leaving attractions are currently not able to visit this attraction.

fields.subtitle: A swinging flight
fields.name: Halve Maen
fields.detail_text: Feel weightless while the largest swinging ship on earth goes up and down. Do you dare to board? Children smaller than 1.20 m must be accompanied. Duration: 2-3 minutes. Wheelchair access: via a dedicated path, next to the usual entrance to this attraction.

fields.subtitle: Can you defeat the dragon?
fields.detail_text:
A superfast wooden racer rollercoaster in which you take on another team of daredevils at more than 45 miles per hour! You have to be at least 1.10 m for this attraction. Duration: 2 minutes.

≤ 17 waiting line: this waiting line is only accessible for people upto and including 17 years of age. There is no need to keep your distance. All seats are allocated and cannot be chosen. Groups can be separated.

Wheelchair access: via the usual entrance to this attraction.
fields.name: Joris en de Draak

fields.subtitle: Chug along
fields.name: Kinderspoor
fields.detail_text: Toodle along through fields and barns. How fast you depends on how hard you want to work in these pedal trains. A fun attraction for the smallest once.

fields.subtitle: Endless fun
fields.name: Kindervreugd
fields.detail_text: In the playground built in the style of Anton Pieck you will find manual roundabouts, seesaws, rolling tuns, swings, animal roundabout, slides and teeter-totters!

fields.subtitle: Fun for little tots
fields.name: Kleuterhof
fields.detail_text: A children's playground for the littlest ones. With a train-roundabout, yellow bear and many seesaws. All equipment in this open air playground are equipped with soft falling mats!

fields.subtitle: Meet these jolly and mischievous people
fields.detail_text: Discover Lavenland from above. Board the Monorail and meet the special 'Volk van Laaf' Laaf People village from another perspective. Duration: 7 minutes.
fields.name: Monorail

fields.subtitle: Dangerously fun spinning
fields.name: Monsieur Cannibale
fields.detail_text: Spin around in one of the cauldrons on the island of Monsieur Cannibale. An attraction full of fun for the whole family. Duration: varies. Wheelchair access: via the usual entrance to this attraction.

fields.subtitle: A marvelous view from above
fields.name: Pagode
fields.detail_text: Turn around at a height of 45 meter and enjoy a phenomenal view of Efteling. Do you dare to look over the edge in this attraction? Duration: 5 minutes. Wheelchair access: via the exit from this attraction.
fields.type: Thai temple with high panoramic views

fields.subtitle: A wild cruise through the Inca Empire
fields.detail_text: Try to brave this 350 meter long wild water river. The rapids determine your route in this adventure without paddles. Children < 1 meter must be kept on an adult's lap. Duration: varies. Wheelchair access: via the exit from this attraction.
fields.name: Piraña

fields.subtitle: Can you escape its stranglehold?
fields.text: Steel roller coaster with double loop
fields.detail_text: Turn your world upside down twice before entering a dizzying corkscrew. Only for daredevils who are at least 1.20 meter tall. Duration: 2 minutes. Wheelchair access: via the exit from this attraction, past the photo point.
fields.name: Python

fields.subtitle: Watch an exciting scene
fields.detail_text: Enter into the 'Spookslot' Haunted Castle and see eerie tableaux where dim figures come to life. This attraction can be frightening for small children. Duration: 12 minutes. Wheelchair access: via the usual entrance to this attraction.
fields.name: Spookslot

fields.subtitle: Fairytales do exist
fields.detail_text: Walk through the Fairytale Forest! Look through the windows of the Seven Kids and see The Red Shoes dance. In the Fairytale Forest dozens of fairytales come to life. Suitable for the entire family!
fields.name: Fairytale Forest

fields.subtitle: The old-fashioned fairground feeling
fields.detail_text: Would you like a horse, a carriage, a pig or another vehicle? Take your seat in the ‘Stoomcarrousel’ steam carousell, which is more than 100 years old, and lit it spin you around! Duration: varies. Wheelchair access: via the exit from this attraction.
fields.name: Stoomcarrousel

fields.subtitle: Discover the park at speed
fields.name: Stoomtrein
fields.detail_text:
Discover Efteling from another perspective. Travel through the various countries by steam train. Due to the corona safety measures, the 'Stoomtrein' steam train will not be stopping at Station de Oost station, until further notice.

Duration: 15-20 minutes.

Wheelchair access: via the exit from this attraction.

fields.subtitle: Discover the park at speed
fields.name: Stoomtrein
fields.detail_text:
Discover Efteling from another perspective. Travel through the various countries by steam train. Board at the station Marerijk and enjoy. Due to the corona safety measures, the 'Stoomtrein' steam train
will not be stopping at Station de Oost station, until further notice.

Duration: 15-20 minutes.

Wheelchair access: via the exit from this attraction.

fields.subtitle: Palace of Fantasy
fields.detail_text:
Experience the family attraction Symbolica dark ride, an enchanting palace where fantasy becomes reality. Wander through secret passages and magical halls that have a surprise around every corner.

Duration: 7 minutes.

Visitors with disabilities can visit Symbolica by checking in with one of our employees standing at the wheelchair entrance (located on the left side near the exit). Until 5.30 pm you can book a time slot so you don’t have to wait at the queue. After 5.30 pm it's possible to walk in freely and join the queue.
fields.name: Symbolica

fields.subtitle: Enter the spinning house…
fields.detail_text: The Villa Volta is a madly turning house whereby the floor and the ceiling can not longer be distinguished. 'Villa Volta' madhouse is not scary, but it does create a dizzying illusion. Duration: 10 minutes. Wheelchair access: next to the usual entrance to this attraction. The first two rooms are accessible to wheelchairs. Unfortunately, the main attraction is inaccessible to wheelchairs for safety reasons. You will be accompanied to a dedicated film room.
fields.name: Villa Volta

fields.subtitle: Lightning in the dark
fields.name: Vogel Rok
fields.detail_text: The Vogel Rok is an exiting indoor rollercoaster in the dark. The rollercoaster does not completely turn over, but does zoom through the dark at 40 mph. You must be at least 1.20 meter tall for this attraction. Duration: almost 2 minutes. Wheelchair access: via the usual entrance to this attraction until the bottom of the stairs. Call here. An employee will then come to meet you.

fields.subtitle: Meet these jolly and mischievous people
fields.name: Volk van Laaf
fields.detail_text:
The Laaf people have been busy going about their daily activities in Efteling for years. Wander through the village and make acquaintance with these small and merry people of Laaf.

Would you rather discover Laafland from above? Then take a tour with the monorail and meet the merry Laaf people from a different perspective.

fields.subtitle: Experience the warmest moments
fields.name: Warme Winter Weide
fields.detail_text: Enjoy winter drinks and delicacies, heartwarming entertainment and cosy  times around two bonfires located in our Winter Garden (Warme Winter Weide).
fields.text: Winter drinks & delicacies, bonfires and entertainment

fields.subtitle: Bicycle storage
fields.name: Bicycle storage
fields.detail_text: You may park your bicycle, moped or scooter in the secure storage area free of charge. A number of places are available for storing electric bikes.
fields.text: Place your bike, motorcycle or scooter in this guarded bicycle shelter

fields.subtitle: Cloakroom
fields.name: Cloakroom
fields.detail_text: You can leave your jacket or bag in the cloakroom at Efteling. The cost is €1.50 per item. The cloakroom is located behind the main entrance, on the Dwarrel Plein.
fields.text: Leave your coat or purse in the guarded cloakroom

fields.subtitle: We are happy to help you
fields.name: Visitors’ Service Centre
fields.detail_text: The Visitors’ Service Centre is on the left at the main entrance. You can go there for any questions about a park visit, annual passes, bookings for the Efteling Theatre or any other questions.

fields.subtitle: Cash dispenser Schatkist
fields.name: Cash dispenser Schatkist
fields.detail_text: This big treasure chest hides a cash machine. Have you tried opening the chest with the big gold key?

fields.subtitle: Cash dispenser
fields.name: Cash dispenser De gouden kluis
fields.detail_text: In addition to a cash dispenser, this vault has extraordinary possibilities. Can you activate the rainbow catcher and locate the pot of gold?

fields.subtitle: Dog kennel
fields.name: Dog kennel
fields.detail_text: Dogs are not permitted to enter the park. Dog owners can use the kennel facilities at the main entrance free of charge. Please note that dogs being looked after in the kennels will not be let out or fed, you are responsible for feeding and walking your pet. You can also bring along a blanket or toy for your dog.

fields.subtitle: Main entrance
fields.name: Main entrance
fields.detail_text: Enter Efteling through the House of the Five Senses.

fields.subtitle: Unlimited access to the Efteling Theme Park during your stay
fields.name: Entrance for hotel guests
fields.detail_text:
The Efteling Hotel is within walking distance of the Efteling Theme Park. It is a few minutes' walk to the special park entrance for hotel guests. 

Furthermore, the theme park opens half an hour earlier than the regular opening times for hotel guests, so you can visit the following attractions: Avonturen Doolhof adventure maze, Kleuterhof children's playground, Vogel Rok indoor roller coaster in the dark, Carnaval Festival, Monsieur Cannibale spinning cauldrons, Villa Volta madhouse, Droomvlucht dark ride, Fata Morgana dark ride, Baron 1898, Python roller coaster with loops, Polka Marina pirates' carousel. All other attractions open at the regular opening times.

At the end of the day, you can return to the Efteling Hotel via the special park entrance for an enchanting overnight stay.
fields.text: Special park entrance for Efteling Hotel guests

fields.subtitle: Unlimited access to the Efteling Theme Park during your stay
fields.name: Entrance overnight guests
fields.detail_text:
There is an extra entrance near the main entrance specially for overnight guests of Holiday Village Efteling Bosrijk and Holiday Village Efteling Loonsche Land. This entrance is open up to two hours after the theme park is opened. If the park opens at 10.00 am, you can make use of the special entrance until 12.00 pm. After that time, you can enter Efteling through the main entrance. 

The Efteling Park is open half an hour earlier than the regular opening times for guests of Holiday Village Efteling Bosrijk and Holiday Village Efteling Loonsche Land. The following attractions will already be open specially for you: Avonturen Doolhof adventure maze, Kleuterhof children's playground, Vogel Rok indoor roller coaster in the dark, Carnaval Festival, Monsieur Cannibale spinning cauldrons, Villa Volta madhouse, Droomvlucht dark ride, Fata Morgana dark ride, Baron 1898, Python roller coaster with loops, Polka Marina pirates' carousel.
fields.text: Specially for guests of Holiday Village Efteling Bosrijk and Holiday Village Efteling Loonsche Land

fields.subtitle: The entry point for an enchanting stay
fields.name: Entrance Holiday Villages Efteling Bosrijk and Efteling Loonsche Land
fields.detail_text: Holiday village Efteling Bosrijk is located a short 10 minute walk from the entrance to the theme park. Holiday village Efteling Loonsche Land is about a 15-minute walk.
fields.text: Stay just a short walk away of the theme park

fields.subtitle: Pumping, resting and praying
fields.name: Room for resting and breastfeeding
fields.detail_text:
In the exciting Ruigrijk area there is a room where you can feed your baby. The room is also suitable for resting if you, due to an illness or disability, need a moment for yourself. You can also come here if you want to pray in silence.

To gain entrance to the room in the Ruigrijk realm, you need a key. This is available at the First aid post in the Marerijk realm, to the left of the Carrousel Paleis.

fields.subtitle: Breastfeeding and resting
fields.name: Room for resting and breastfeeding
fields.detail_text:
You can feed your baby in the breastfeeding room in the Station de Oost restaurant. The room is also suitable for caring for recumbent disabled visitors or adults.

The room at the Station de Oost restaurant can be opened by one of the employees there.
fields.text: Room in Station de Oost restaurant

fields.subtitle: Breastfeeding and resting
fields.name: Room for resting and breastfeeding
fields.detail_text:
You can feed your baby in the breastfeeding room in the Laaf People Village. Power outlets are available in this room. It is also suitable for caring for recumbent disabled visitors or adults.

You need a key to access this room. Please ask it at the first aid post in the Marerijk realm, to the left of the Carrousel Paleis.

fields.subtitle: Parking spaces
fields.name: Parking spaces for disabled visitors
fields.detail_text: Paid parking spaces have been reserved for disabled visitors in the front rows of the car park. If you have a European disability parking card you may use these. Please inform one of the car park attendants who will indicate where to park. You will still need a car park ticket.

fields.subtitle: Car park
fields.name: Parking spaces for electric cars
fields.detail_text: Efteling has charging stations (against payment) for electric cars. You must bring your own charging cable with you. Please ask one of the car park attendants, who will indicate where to find them.

fields.subtitle: By car to Efteling
fields.name: Car park
fields.detail_text:
Efteling has a sufficient number of parking spaces.The parking fee for motorized vehicles is € 12.50 per day. You can buy a car park ticket online or at one of the ticket machines located at main entrance.

Tip: use the icons of the Fairytale Forest characters to remember where you parked your car.
fields.text: Park your car on the spatious parking lot

fields.subtitle: Wheelchair rental
fields.name: Wheelchair rental
fields.detail_text:
Efteling has a limited number of wheelchairs that can be rented free of charge on the basis of availability. The wheelchair desk can be found on the  Dwarrel Plein, to your left after the main entrance.

Useful information: The Efteling wheelchairs have small back wheels and you will therefore always need a companion to push the wheelchair. Besides this, the footrests of the wheelchairs cannot be folded horizontally and are therefore not suitable for keeping your leg up.

fields.subtitle: Theme Park exit
fields.name: Theme Park exit
fields.detail_text: You can leave Efteling through the main entrance.

fields.subtitle: Rent a stroller
fields.name: Stroller rental
fields.detail_text: Strollers are available to rent for € 4.50 per day. These carts have one seat and are suitable for one toddler. Pushchairs and buggies may not/cannot be taken into all attractions and restaurants.  The stroller rental is located behind the main entrance, on the Dwarrel Plein.
fields.text: Suitable for little ones and toddlers

fields.instruction_text: To ensure safety in our Badhuys swimming pool, the maximum group size is 6 people. This will be checked at the entrance to the swimming pool.
fields.subtitle: Water fun for young and old
fields.name: Badhuys indoor splash pool
fields.detail_text:
Come and splash in the warm water, let yourself be swept away by the rapids or unwind in the Jacuzzi. In the Badhuys in Efteling Bosrijk you can completely relax. This indoor water playground has a baby bath, paddling pool, large swimming pool and various play elements. Come enjoy the joys of water with the whole family!

Conditions Badhuys

  • Be on time, but not to early (About 10 minutes before the time you made a reservation for).
  • During this time it is not possible to enter the Badhuys using your keycard. Our staff will open the doors for you.
  • Visit the swimmingpool with your household only.
  • Only 5 households are allowed inside the swimmingpool at the same time.
  • Please put on your bathingsuit before coming to the swimmingpool.
  • Unfortunately you are not allowed to shower at the swimming pool. You can take a shower in your own accomodation.
  • Please folow our staffs instructions.
fields.text: Het Badhuys is open to guests of Efteling Bosrijk and the Efteling Hotel

fields.name: First Aid Point
fields.detail_text: In case of emergency we politely request that you consult a member of Efteling staff.

fields.name: Toilet Carnaval Festival
fields.detail_text: Use of the toilets is free of charge. An adapted toilet is also available here.

fields.name: Toilets Diorama
fields.detail_text: Use of the toilets is free of charge. An adapted toilet is available, where you can also change the diapers of your baby.

fields.name: Toilet Dwarrelplein
fields.detail_text: Use of the toilets is free of charge.

fields.name: Toilets Fata Morgana
fields.detail_text: Use of the toilets is free of charge. An adapted toilet is available, where you can also change the diapers of your baby.

fields.name: Toilets Het Witte Paard
fields.detail_text: Use of the toilets is free of charge. An adapted toilet is available, where you can also change the diapers of your baby.

fields.name: Toilets Hoofdentree
fields.detail_text: Use of the toilets is free of charge. An adapted toilet is available, where you can also change the diapers of your baby.

fields.name: Toilets Kleine boodschap
fields.detail_text: Use of the toilets is free of charge. An adapted toilet is also available here.

fields.name: Toilet Panorama
fields.detail_text: Use of the toilets is free of charge.

fields.name: Toilet near Spookslot
fields.detail_text: Use of the toilets is free of charge.

fields.name: Toilet Pythonweide
fields.detail_text: Use of the toilets is free of charge.

fields.name: Toilet Speelweide
fields.detail_text: Use of the toilets is free of charge.

fields.name: Toilets Kleuterhof
fields.detail_text: Use of the toilets is free of charge. An adapted toilet is available, where you can also change the diapers of your baby.

fields.name: Toilets Meermin
fields.detail_text: Use of the toilets is free of charge. An adapted toilet is also available here.

fields.name: Toilets Fabula
fields.detail_text: Use of the toilets is free of charge. An adapted toilet is available, where you can also change the diapers of your baby.

fields.name: Toilets Polles Keuken
fields.detail_text: Use of the toilets is free of charge. An adapted toilet is available, where you can also change the diapers of your baby.

fields.name: Toilets Spookslot
fields.detail_text: Use of the toilets is free of charge. An adapted toilet is also available here.

fields.name: Toilets Station de Oost
fields.detail_text: Use of the toilets is free of charge. An adapted toilet is available, where you can also change the diapers of your baby.

fields.name: Toilets 't Gemack
fields.detail_text: Use of the toilets is free of charge. An adapted toilet is also available here.

fields.name: De Bazaar
fields.detail_text:
The shop has 1001 souvenirs to create a Middle Eastern ambiance at home. Visit before or after your ride through the Fata Morgana forbidden city.

No need to delay buying your loveliest Efteling mementos to the end of the day. We will bring all souvenirs to the exit of the park for free. Ask a employee at the souvenir shop where and at what time you could pick up your souvenir. If you are staying at the Efteling Hotel, Holiday Village Efteling Bosrijk or Holiday Village Efteling Loonsche Land, we will bring the souvenirs to the related reception.

fields.name: De Gulden Gaarde
fields.detail_text:
A shop full of elves, dresses and other nice souvenirs to dream away at home. You’re certain to go through this shop after a Droomvlucht ride.

No need to delay buying your loveliest Efteling mementos to the end of the day. We will bring all souvenirs to the exit of the park for free. Ask a employee at the souvenir shop where and at what time you could pick up your souvenir. If you are staying at the Efteling Hotel, Holiday Village Efteling Bosrijk or Holiday Village Efteling Loonsche Land, we will bring the souvenirs to the related reception.

fields.name: Efteldingen
fields.detail_text:
This is the largest souvenir shop in the Efteling. You'll find all kinds of fun Efteling mementos to take home.

No need to delay buying your loveliest Efteling mementos to the end of the day. We will bring all souvenirs to the exit of the park for free. Ask a employee at the souvenir shop where and at what time you could pick up your souvenir. If you are staying at the Efteling Hotel, Holiday Village Efteling Bosrijk or Holiday Village Efteling Loonsche Land, we will bring the souvenirs to the related reception.

fields.name: Fabula
fields.detail_text:
The souvenir shop has all the best souvenirs, such as cuddly toys, fancy dress, tableware and key rings.

No need to delay buying your loveliest Efteling mementos to the end of the day. We will bring all souvenirs to the exit of the park for free. Ask a employee at the souvenir shop where and at what time you could pick up your souvenir. If you are staying at the Efteling Hotel, Holiday Village Efteling Bosrijk or Holiday Village Efteling Loonsche Land, we will bring the souvenirs to the related reception.

fields.name: In den Ouden Marskramer
fields.detail_text:
You will find a mix of fairytale items as well as a Sprookjesboom in this souvenir shop.

No need to delay buying your loveliest Efteling mementos to the end of the day. We will bring all souvenirs to the exit of the park for free. Ask a employee at the souvenir shop where and at what time you could pick up your souvenir. If you are staying at the Efteling Hotel, Holiday Village Efteling Bosrijk or Holiday Village Efteling Loonsche Land, we will bring the souvenirs to the related reception.

fields.name: Jokies Wereld
fields.detail_text:
Fly home and around the world with Jokie and his girlfriend Jet. You’ll find a large selection of Jokie and Jet thingambobs in this shop.

No need to delay buying your loveliest Efteling mementos to the end of the day. We will bring all souvenirs to the exit of the park for free. Ask a employee at the souvenir shop where and at what time you could pick up your souvenir. If you are staying at the Efteling Hotel, Holiday Village Efteling Bosrijk or Holiday Village Efteling Loonsche Land, we will bring the souvenirs to the related reception.

fields.name: Souvenir Pick Up
fields.detail_text: You can pick up the souvenir(s) you purchased online here. Please take the confirmation e-mail with you when you collect your souvenir(s).
fields.text: Take home fond memories of your Efteling visit.

fields.name: Spiegeltje, spiegeltje
fields.detail_text:
Do you like dressing up? Then this costume shop full of clothes and fashion accessories will be your idea of heaven! Visit this shop in the middle of the Anton Pieck Plein.

No need to delay buying your loveliest Efteling mementos to the end of the day. We will bring all souvenirs to the exit of the park for free. Ask a employee at the souvenir shop where and at what time you could pick up your souvenir. If you are staying at the Efteling Hotel, Holiday Village Efteling Bosrijk or Holiday Village Efteling Loonsche Land, we will bring the souvenirs to the related reception.

fields.name: Symbolica
fields.detail_text:
After a visit to Symbolica, you will find here the most enchanting souvenirs of the Palace of Fantasy.

No need to delay buying your loveliest Efteling mementos to the end of the day. We will bring all souvenirs to the exit of the park for free. Ask a employee at the souvenir shop where and at what time you could pick up your souvenir. If you are staying at the Efteling Hotel, Holiday Village Efteling Bosrijk or Holiday Village Efteling Loonsche Land, we will bring the souvenirs to the related reception.

fields.name: Station de Oost: First Class Waiting Room
fields.detail_text: Type: takeaway. At the First Class Waiting Room, you can enjoy all sorts of hot and cold drinks and a choice of various sweet treats.
fields.text: Hot and cold drinks, sweet treats

fields.name: Station de Oost: De Hongerige Machinist snackbar
fields.detail_text: Type: takeaway. Snack to your heart's content at De Hongerige Machinist snackbar. Enjoy delicious French fries with a snack and drink of your choice.

fields.name: Station de Oost: De Rustende Reiziger takeaway
fields.detail_text: Type: Take-away. Ready for some lunch or an afternoon treat? Come and visit De Rustende Reiziger and enjoy a drink, sandwich, salad, savoury or sweet snack!
fields.text: Sandwiches, salads, snacks, drinks and ice cream

fields.name: Station de Oost: De Brutale Aap takeaway
fields.detail_text: Type: takeaway. Enjoy the Oriental atmosphere in De Brutale Aap takeaway. Choose from various types of hallal meat, including doner kebab and Turkish pizzas. Combine your meal with a bottle of soft drink of your choice.
fields.text: Doner kebab, Turkish pizza and soft drinks

fields.name: Station de Oost: De Verse Oogst takeaway
fields.detail_text: Type: takeaway. At De Verse Oogst takeaway, you can enjoy freshly made salads and filled bread rolls.

fields.subtitle: Taste authentic flavours
fields.text: Coffee, treats, burgers, meal boxes en salads
fields.detail_text: Fabula restaurant currently has a limited menu as a take-away location.
fields.name: Fabula Restaurant
Currywurst stand
fields.detail_text: Enjoy a traditional currywurst sandwich on the Max & Moritz Plein. Your currywurst is freshly grilled on the smoker while you wait.
fields.text: Grilled currywurst and selection of cold drinks
fields.type: Grilled currywurst and selection of cold drinks

fields.name: Burger Backery
fields.detail_text: Type: takeaway. Fancy a burger? Then this is the place. The De Burger grills fresh hamburgers, cheeseburgers and veggie burgers.

fields.name: Burgerhuys de Likkebaerd
fields.detail_text: After a ride in one of the roller coasters in the exciting Ruigrijk realm, enjoy a freshly grilled burger. At De Likkebaerd, you can choose from three different beef burgers and one vegetarian burger.

fields.name: Casa Caracol
fields.detail_text: Type: takeaway. Fancy a wrap or warm panini? Then stop by the Casa Caracol. On sunny days, this is also a wonderful place to rest at the terrace and sip a hot or cold drink.

fields.name: De Gebrande Boon
fields.detail_text: Type: takeaway. Do you fancy a freshly brewed cup of coffee? Then walk along to the De Gebrande Boon! Here, you'll find a selectiojn of warm drinks and savory and sweet delicacies.

fields.subtitle: Enjoy fresh treats
fields.detail_text: Type: Take-away. At the De Gelaarsde Kat kiosk you can enjoy the most delicious freshly grilled sandwiches. And for the ones who'd rather have some vitamines, there's a choice of  fruit and juices!
fields.name: In de Gelaarsde Kat

fields.subtitle: Tasty and healthy food in Efteling
fields.name: De Gulden Gaarde
fields.detail_text: Type: takeaway. You can find fresh fruit salads, soups, smoothies, salads, healthy snacks and refreshing lemonade without added sugar at Den Gulden Gaarde snack bar. The healthiest spot in Efteling with loads of responsible products.

fields.name: De Verkleumde Kompel
fields.detail_text: Need a little break after your ride in Baron 1898? During your visit to Winter Efteling you can enjoy delicious hot chocolate, with all kinds of toppings of your choice!

fields.name: De Kombuys
fields.detail_text: Type: Take-away. Fancy a hot or a cold drink with a delicious apple turnover? Come visit De Kombuys! On hot days you can get soft ice cream here too.
fields.text: Soft ice cream, apple turnover, hot and cold drinks

fields.name: De Meermin
fields.detail_text: Type: takeaway. For fresh fried fish or other seafood specialities, visit the De Meermin.

fields.name: De Smaeckmaker
fields.detail_text:
Customise your own Unox bread roll at De Smaeckmaker at Hartenhof court! Choose a white or brown bread roll, the original Unox smoked sausage or the 100% vegetable Smoked Sausage from the Vegetarian Butcher, a delicious sauce, two toppings and a soft drink of your choice.

This winter you can enjoy an Unox Winterspecial: a real Dutch hot dog in bun with cheese sauce, paprika-tabasco sauce and fried onions.

fields.name: De Soete Inval
fields.detail_text: Type: sweets shop. You will find a large selection of delicious old-fashioned sweets in this small sweets shop. Fill your own sweets bag or choose a bag of Efteling chocolates.

fields.name: Den Suykerbuyk
fields.detail_text: Type: Take-away. Fancy something sweet? Visit the Den Suykerbuyk for freshly baked waffles or an ice cream!
fields.text: Fresh waffles, ice cream, hot and cold drinks

fields.name: De Verleiding
fields.detail_text: Sticks of rock, lollipops and the original Jelly Beans can be found here. It’s worth a visit just to see the shop front! Type: sweets shop

fields.name: De Vrolijke Noot
fields.detail_text: De Vrolijke Noot currently has a limited menu as a take-away location.
fields.text: Sandwiches, salads, hot meals, children's menu, hot and cold drinks and pastries

fields.name: Frau Boltes Küche
fields.detail_text: Feeling peckish then visit Frau Boltes, Max & Moritz’ neighbour! Enjoy delicious French fries, classic snacks and a real Bengel Bucket filled with chicken vegetarian treats.

fields.name: Happiness station Glad ijs
fields.detail_text: Type: takeaway. You will find a huge selection of ice cream here.

fields.name: Happiness Station Het Witte Paard
fields.detail_text: Type: takeaway. You will find a huge selection of ice cream here.

fields.name: Het Seylend Fregat
fields.detail_text: Type: Take-away. Fancy a bag of popcorn, large or small? Or freshly twisted candy floss, a hot drink or an ice cream? Visit Seylend Fregat!
fields.text: Popcorn, candy floss, ice cream, hot and cold drinks

fields.name: Hollandsche Gebakkraam
fields.detail_text: Type: takeaway. This old-style doughnut stall cooks up all sorts of typical Dutch treats like doughnuts and sweets.

fields.name: In den Hoorn des Overvloeds
fields.detail_text: Type: takeaway. Soft ice cream, different snacks like almond paste cake and refreshing cold drinks. That’s what you’ll find at the Hoorn des Overvloeds.

fields.subtitle: At the heart of the Fairytale Forest
fields.name: Kleyne Klaroen
fields.detail_text: Type: takeaway. Enjoy a delicious cup of coffee or soft drink or one of the many bakery treats. How about an apple turnover, brownie or savoury sausage roll?

fields.subtitle: In the middle of the Faiytale Forest
fields.name: Kogeloog
fields.detail_text: This winter you can visit the Kogeloog kiosk and get a delicious warm drink. Choose from one of the speciality coffees or do you fancy a hot chocolate?

fields.subtitle: After work had been done
fields.name: 't Melkhuysje
fields.detail_text: Type: takeaway. After a ride on the Baron 1898 roller coaster, enjoy a delicious milkshake at the Het Melkhuisje. Pizzas are available for those who are more hungry.

fields.name: Oase
fields.detail_text: Type: Take-away. At the Oasis, there are halal dining options such as Döner Kebab and Turkish Pizza.
fields.text: Döner kebab, Turkish pizza and soft ice cream

fields.subtitle: Step inside
fields.name: Panorama à la carte
fields.detail_text: Type: restaurant. Step inside this a la carte restaurant for a delicious hot meal or salad. You have a choice of starters, main courses and desserts. Meat, fish and vegetarian are options. The menu has several dishes for our younger guests.

fields.subtitle: Enjoy a delicious break
fields.name: Panorama Take-away
fields.detail_text: Type: Take-away. Panorama currently has a limited menu as a take-away location.
fields.text: Baguette sandwiches, meals, salads, ice creams and cold drinks

fields.name: Panorama kiosk
fields.detail_text: Here you can enjoy sweet and savoury treats, beer specials, wines, prosecco, cold and hot beverages.
fields.text: Sweet and savoury treats, cold and hot beverages

fields.subtitle: Dine in a genuine Italian restaurant
fields.name: Pinokkio’s pizza & pasta restaurant
fields.detail_text: Pinokkios pizza & pasta restaurant currently has a limited menu as a take-away location.

fields.subtitle: Typically Dutch specialities
fields.detail_text: Type: Take-away. Enjoy the tastiest Dutch treat and the skills of our "poffertjes" cooks!
fields.name: 't Poffertje Take-away

fields.subtitle: Come and have a majestic breakfast, lunch or dinner
fields.detail_text: Polles Keuken currently has a limited menu as a take-away location.
fields.name: Polles Keuken
Rondje van de Molen
fields.detail_text: Type: Take-away. The doughnuts can't get more delicious than the fresh baked mini doughnuts at Rondje van de Molen. You can always stop here for a delicious drink too!
fields.text: Fresh doughnuts, hot and cold drinks

fields.name: Smulpaap
fields.detail_text: Type: takeaway. Enjoy a tasty treat of fries and a snack. During winter you can also enjoy vegetarian loaded fries with mushroom stew, rocket salad, red onion and truffle mayonnaise.

fields.name: Stroopwafel-chalet
fields.detail_text: Enjoy a delicious fresh syrup waffle with a warm drink at Max & Moritz Plein. During the Winter Efteling you can also go here for mulled wine and Schrobbler (a typical Dutch herb liqueur).
fields.text: Freshly baked syrup waffles and hot beverages
fields.type: Freshly baked syrup waffles and hot beverages

fields.name: 't Suyker Huys
fields.detail_text: Type: takeaway. Fancy a large or small bucket of popcorn? Or delicious, freshly spun candyfloss? Then drop by the Suykerhuys candyfloss stand! Here you can enjoy twinkling glittery candyfloss on a magic wand!

fields.name: 't Gebraad
fields.detail_text: Type: Take-away. 't Gebraad is the place to go for a traditional meatball in a bun (vegetarian option also available) or sausage (vegetarian option also available) with sate sauce or a cold sauce of your choice.

fields.name: 't Korfje
fields.detail_text: Type: takeaway. Fancy something sweet like cake or sweets while the kids play in the Kleuterhof? Then stop by the ’t Korfje. Hot and cold drinks are also available.

fields.subtitle: Enjoy Asian food
fields.name: Toko Pagode
fields.detail_text: Type: takeaway. Here you can enjoy oriental dishes such as noodles, fried rice or plain rice where you can add a sauce of your choice. Naturally, you may just want to relax while sipping your drink. Or, on warm days, enjoy a cooling ice cream.
fields.text: Fried rice, rice, coffee and ice cream

fields.name: Het Wapen van Raveleijn
fields.detail_text: Type: restaurant. In Het Wapen van Raveleijn restaurant you can enjoy a tasty Burgundian three-course menu. The locals invite you to enjoy a glorious meal in Raveleijn's most popular restaurant.

fields.subtitle: In the heart of the Efteling
fields.text: Bread roll sandwich, meal and salad
fields.detail_text: Het Witte Paard currently has a limited menu as a take-away location.
fields.name: Het Witte Paard
Shop
fields.detail_text: In this temporary shop you can find pre-packaged goods, comparable to the items you would find sold at petrol station and train station shops.

fields.name: Warme Winter Weide
fields.detail_text:
The Winter Garden (Warme Winter Weide) is the ideal location to warm yourself up with a warm winter drink and delicacies.

Would you like to have a warm winter drink? Then you can choose from several of our winter specials: mulled wine special, Red velvet Latte Macchiato and Chocomel Chip Cookie Special.

Is your stomach in for a delicacy? Then you can choose from the typical winter delicacies at the Winter Garden, Warme Winter Weide. Enjoy a typical Dutch hot dog in a bun (the Unox Winterspecial), pea soup or choose a sweet delicacy such as hot cinnamon rolls or stuffed speculaas.

fields.name: Witte Walvis
fields.detail_text: Type: takeaway. Need a drink before taking a walk in the haunted house? At the Witte Walvis, you’ll find ice cream, sweets and hot and cold drinks. Of course, you may want to recover after your adventure in the Spookslot.

fields.name: Eigenheymer Ruigrijk
fields.detail_text: Take away. A delicious fried potato snack seasoned with your choice of spices.

fields.name: Eigenheymer Anderrijk
fields.detail_text: Take away. A delicious fried potato snack seasoned with your choice of spices.

fields.name: Eigenheymer Marerijk
fields.detail_text: Take away. A delicious fried potato snack seasoned with your choice of spices.

fields.name: Unox stall Anderrijk
fields.detail_text: Take away. Typically Dutch Unox hot dog with a smoked sausage and special Unox sauce. A vegetarian hot dog is also available.

fields.name: Unox stall Marerijk
fields.detail_text: Take away. Typically Dutch Unox hot dog with a smoked sausage and special Unox sauce. A vegetarian hot dog is also available.

fields.name: Unox stall Ruigrijk
fields.detail_text: Take away. Typically Dutch Unox hot dog with a smoked sausage and special Unox sauce. A vegetarian hot dog is also available.

fields.name: Unox stall Reizenrijk
fields.detail_text: Take away. Typically Dutch Unox hot dog with a smoked sausage and special Unox sauce. A vegetarian hot dog is also available.

fields.subtitle: Winter chalet
fields.name: Winter chalet Ton van de Ven Plein
fields.detail_text: Warm yourself up at the bonfires while sipping on your warm winter special, a coffee- or Chocomel specials. You can also go there for a delicious and fresh syrup waffle.

fields.subtitle: Winter chalet
fields.name: Winter chalet Ruigrijk
fields.detail_text: Warm yourself up at the bonfires while sipping on your warm winter special, a coffee- or Chocomel specials.

fields.subtitle: A spectacular show of water, light and fire
fields.detail_text: A spectacular water show with Efteling music where water, fire and light flow together. More than 200 fountains and 900 lights transport you to another level during this 12-minute Efteling Medley.
fields.name: Aquanura

fields.instruction_text: Please note: a Boarding Pass is required to see the show. Come to the entrance of Raveleijn 10 minutes before the start of the show.
fields.subtitle: Courageous riders entered the city of Raveleijn
fields.name: Raveleijn
fields.detail_text:
There is an adapted show, due to the corona precautions. There are no translation headphones available at this moment.

Watch how Countess Halina teaches five young people how to protect the magical city of Raveleijn from evil.

If a member of your group uses a wheelchiar you don't have to reserve a Boarding Pass for them.  Inform a member of staff, at the entrance that you are a wheelchair user and they will lead you to the special wheelchair section. Only one person may accompany the guest to the wheelchair viewing area. Due to the social distancing measures, there are only a limited number of wheelchair spaces available.

fields.subtitle: Deeply rooted in the Fairytale Forest
fields.name: Sprookjesboomshow
fields.detail_text: Visit the Open Air Theatre where the Fairytale Forest characters have prepared a show. Sit down and relax on one of the benches and listen to the winter stories of Long Neck or Cinderella. During the sing-along show of Wolf and Little Red Riding Hood it is almost impossible to sit still! (Dutch spoken)

fields.subtitle: Meet the merry Magic Jester
fields.name: Pardoes the magician or Princess Pardijn
fields.detail_text: Greet Pardoes the magician or Princess Pardijn in our Winter Garden (Warme Winter Weide).

fields.subtitle: Meet Little Red Riding Hood
fields.name: Little Red Riding Hood
fields.detail_text: Meet and greet Little Red Riding Hood in our Winter Garden (Warme Winter Weide).

fields.subtitle: Join the adventure!
fields.name: Jokie en Jet
fields.detail_text: You can see Jokie or Jet alternately in a new solo show. Who knows, maybe you can go on an adventure with Jokie and Jet! (Dutch spoken)

fields.subtitle: Once upon a time...
fields.name: Cinderella
fields.detail_text: Cinderella scrubbed and polished without complaining, even though her hands were sore. If you try to live a good life, life will be good to you. She smiled to herself. At the ball, the prince had danced with her and with nobody else, all evening. Her annoying stepsisters hadn’t even recognised her! Just then, there was a knock at the door and the prince appeared, holding her slipper … The slipper she had lost when she ran down the flight of stairs at the palace. The prince had vowed to marry whomever the shoe fits. Would he recognise her? Would the slipper still fit?

fields.subtitle: Once upon a time...
fields.name: The Chinese Nightingale
fields.detail_text: The emperor of China received a gift from the emperor of Japan: An imitation nightingale, studded with sparkling diamonds and sapphires. The beautiful, jewelled bird sung so sweetly that the emperor wanted to hear it every day. One day, the bird stopped singing. The emperor was inconsolable and fell very ill, until a real nightingale flew in at his open window and began to sing its enchanted song...

fields.subtitle: Once upon a time...
fields.name: The Dragon
fields.detail_text: For centuries the iron crown had been passed down from father to son, king to prince. But the witch stole the crown and the winged dragon guarded it for her. “Disastrous!” cried the king. “What will become of our land now that the crown is gone?” Superstition or not, floods plagued the land and the harvest failed. The peace-loving king eventually sent a band of twenty brave knights to retrieve the crown, but to no avail. Could Vico, the farmer’s son, and his sister Bella defeat the dragon?

fields.subtitle: Once upon a time...
fields.name: The Emperor’s New Clothes
fields.detail_text: Whichever way the emperor turned towards the mirror, he could see no new clothes. Only the wrinkles in his bare skin. Was he stupid and lazy? The court ladies celebrated the robes as being perfect for the annual procession. Hundreds of people arrived to see the new clothes. The emperor puffed out his chest and stepped outside... He heard applause and gasps of oooh! and aaah! But one young boy suddenly cried “The emperor’s not wearing anything!” After a moment’s silence the people all began to laugh and jeer... And the emperor? He completed the stately procession but he would never again be vain.

fields.subtitle: Once upon a time...
fields.name: The Gardener and the Fakir
fields.detail_text: The wealthy sultan had grown tired of all his riches. One day, he was given sacks of tulip bulbs, which he gave to his gardener and forgot about. The gardener planted them in the palace gardens. When an old fakir passed by, the gardener offered him a drink. In gratitude the fakir played his ivory flute and flew above the palace on his magic carpet. Suddenly, colourful tulips began to emerge from the ground. The astonished gardener called the sultan, who saw the simple flowers from his window and was immediately cured...

fields.subtitle: Once upon a time...
fields.name: The Wolf and the Seven Kids
fields.detail_text: When mother goat went shopping, she told her seven kids that they must not to open the door of their cottage to anyone. Sadly, the bad wolf tricked the kids with the soft voice and white hooves of mother goat, and they let him in. Once inside, the bad wolf swallowed the kids whole, except for the youngest, who managed to quickly hide in the big grandfather clock. Inconsolable, mother goat and the youngest kid set off together in search of bad the wolf…

fields.subtitle: Once upon a time…
fields.detail_text:
Take a seat on the back of one of the six swans or walk through the castle to see this fairytale. Wheelchair users can see this fairytale via the walking route to the right of the castle.

Once upon a time, there was a king with six sons and a sweet, clever daughter called Elisa. They loved each other dearly. When the king remarried, he hid his children in a secret castle. Would the new queen treat his children well? One day the jealous queen discovered the secret of the children hidden in the castle and changed the six princes into swans. To break the spell, their little sister Elisa would have to knit six shirts from aster flowers and would not be allowed to speak or laugh for six years. Elisa valiantly began to knit, for months, all alone in the castle. The work made her hands blister, but she persevered. Once in a while, the six swans visited their sister in the castle lake, which made Elisa even more determined to finish the shirts. Would Elisa succeed in breaking the spell?
fields.name: The Six Swans

fields.subtitle: Once upon a time...
fields.name: Sleeping Beauty
fields.detail_text: At long last, the king and queen had a baby. A wicked fairy cursed the little princess. On her fifteenth birthday, she would prick her finger on a spinning wheel and die. A good fairy decreed that the princess would not die, but sleep for a hundred years. And so it came to pass! Everyone in the castle fell asleep… Gradually, an impenetrable rose hedge grew up around the castle. After almost a hundred years, a young prince arrived and the briars parted before him. He found Sleeping Beauty, and kissed her awake…

fields.subtitle: Once upon a time...
fields.name: Donkey lift your Tail
fields.detail_text: “Table... Be laid!” cried the tailor’s son at the inn. He’d received the magic table as reward for his hard work and, suddenly, it was covered with delicious food. The innkeeper was astonished. That night he swapped the magic table for a normal one. The second tailor’s son received a wondrous donkey, which shot out golden coins when the boy cried “Donkey... Lift your tail!” After the innkeeper had replaced this magical animal too, the second cheated son also came home to his father. The third son visited the inn with a magical club, which gave the dishonest innkeeper a sound beating!

fields.subtitle: Once upon a time...
fields.name: Hansel and Gretel
fields.detail_text: Abandoned in the forest by her stepmother, Hansel and Gretel wandered throughout the night. The breadcrumbs Hansel had scattered to find their way home had been eaten by birds. What would they do? They wandered around for hours, until they found a very peculiar house hidden behind a big oak tree. The roof was made of pancakes and the sugar-coated walls were covered in sweet pretzels. There were even lemonade fountains! Their stomachs grumbled. Did they dare take a bite to eat? Then a shutter on the front door flew open. “Nibble, nibble, little mouse, who is nibbling at my house?”...

fields.subtitle: Once upon a time...
fields.name: Guinevere’s Bridal Gown
fields.detail_text: “Sky blue,” said the old lady. “Now sunflower yellow and then pine tree green.” The weaver woman moved the loom back and forth, while the doves fetched the coloured thread she needed. Their feathers became coloured from it. Because she had looked after them so well during winter, they were happy to help her weave. And so the blind weaver woman was able to make the most beautiful bridal gown, without ever seeing it. Guinevere got the wedding dress she’d always wanted with all the colours of the rainbow...

fields.subtitle: Once upon a time...
fields.name: The little Match Girl
fields.detail_text: On a bitterly cold evening, the last evening of the old year, a poor little girl sat huddled between two houses. In her old apron, she carried a large number of matches, but no one had bought anything from her all day. Could she strike a match to warm her hands? Scratch... the little flame gave her a wonderful warm feeling. She saw a warm stove, a festive table laid splendidly and a steaming roast goose, a beautifully decorated Christmas tree with thousands of candles and finally, the dear grandmother she missed so much...

fields.subtitle: Once upon a time...
fields.name: The Naughty Princess
fields.detail_text: A king was given a parrot that would not speak a word. Instead, his daughter began to repeat everything that people said. The princess had great fun mimicking people but everyone in the castle soon grew tired of her game. She was punished but that didn't help. The naughty princess continued to repeat everything until, one day, she was turned into a parrot by a witch. The parrot flew back to the castle and the king and queen were very happy with the talking bird. But they became terribly sad when they realised that their daughter was missing. It took days before the parrot changed back into the princess, by which time she'd learnt her lesson.

fields.subtitle: Once upon a time...
fields.name: The Indian Water Lilies
fields.detail_text: In the dense jungle of India, there lived a hideously ugly witch, who owned an incredibly beautiful voice. With it, she could enchant anyone. At night, the moon goddess and her star children appeared to dance on the water. The witch was jealous of their shining beauty. One morning, she cast a spell on some of the star children and turned them into exquisite water lilies forever. And only on moonlit nights the witch returns, and then it happens...

fields.subtitle: Once upon a time...
fields.name: The Gnome Village
fields.detail_text: One morning Diddlydum, the musical gnome from the gnome village, accidentally locked the door to his hollow tree behind him one morning. And the key was still inside. What should he do? He needed to make music. No one had time to help him. The washer gnome was too busy washing, Roddy was busy fishing and the writing gnome needed to finish his book. Then the gnome village descended into chaos. There was no music. Everything was quiet! Luckily, everything worked out fine. Look, there’s Diddlydum, sitting behind his piano...

fields.subtitle: Once upon a time...
fields.name: The Frog Prince
fields.detail_text: The princess’s golden ball fell into the castle pond with a big splash. The young girl was inconsolable. In exchange for her friendship a fat, ugly frog dived for the ball. However the princess did not keep her word, and would not let the frog into the castle. Her wise father insisted that she keep her promise. The slimy creature was allowed to sleep in the princess’s bed, and had the right to be kissed goodnight. The kiss broke the enchantment, and the frog turned into a handsome young prince…

fields.subtitle: Once upon a time...
fields.name: Tom Thumb
fields.detail_text: When left in the forest by their very poor parents, Tom Thumb and his six brothers set about searching for a way home. When they finally came to the house of an evil Giant, they decided to hide there for the night. However, the Giant discovered the boys, and tried to catch them, but Tom Thumb was always too quick and clever for him. After a wild chase, the Giant fell asleep against a tree and Tom Thumb decided to steal the Giant’s enormous Seven League Boots…

fields.subtitle: Once upon a time...
fields.name: Wee Walter Messenger
fields.detail_text: Once upon a time there was a beautiful land, filled with thick forests and woodland paths. You could easily get lost there, so the king appointed a messenger to show everyone the way: Wee Walter Messenger. One day Walter was taking a nap in the grass when a blackbird plucked the red plume from his hat. From that moment on, he no longer knew the way. How awful, because now everyone would get lost! That very day the king brought his trusty messenger a new plume for services rendered. Walter stuck it in his hat and guess what? Suddenly he knew the way again… So everything worked out fine!

fields.subtitle: Once upon a time...
fields.name: The Little Mermaid
fields.detail_text: When the handsome prince of her dreams is shipwrecked, the little mermaid brings him to dry land. To wake him, she sings a beautiful song with her enchanting voice. But she remembers sorrowfully that he can never fall in love with her because of her fish’s tail. An old sea witch gives her legs, in return, she must give up her most valuable possession: her voice. Once she reaches land, however, she is unable to tell the prince that she loves him dearly...

fields.subtitle: Once upon a time...
fields.name: The Magic Clock
fields.detail_text: Six vain princes ordered a clock from a wizard for the castle square, on which they would be depicted as brave knights. When the clock was ready, the princes decided that three bags of gold was too expensive and refused to honour their agreement. The wizard angrily set out to find another buyer for the clock. While he was gone, his sneaky servant delivered the clock to the princes for just one bag of gold. When the wizard discovered this treachery, he turned the princes and the servant to stone. Ever since, the princes have heralded each quarter of an hour with their trumpets...

fields.subtitle: Once upon a time...
fields.detail_text: Geppetto the carpenter wanted a son so badly that he made himself a wooden puppet, which he named Pinocchio. Geppetto was overjoyed when a blue fairy brought Pinocchio to life. But the gullible wooden puppet had a lot to learn before he could become a real boy. So, his father sent him to school. On the way there, the sly Fox and the stupid Cat persuaded Pinocchio to join them on all kinds of adventure. Whenever he lied to Geppetto, his nose grew a couple of centimetres. One terrible day, Pinocchio did not come home from school and Geppetto set out on a desperate search for him, by land and sea... Where could Pinocchio be?
fields.name: Pinocchio

fields.subtitle: Once upon a time...
fields.name: Rapunzel
fields.detail_text: Rapunzel was so beautiful that the wicked Witch shut her up in a tower without a door. When her food was brought, the girl hung her long plait of hair out of the window, so that the witch could climb up it. One day, a young prince visited Rapunzel in the same way, and they fell in love immediately. Furious, the witch banished Rapunzel. The broken-hearted prince jumped out of the tower window, and became blind... Years later Rapunzel found him again, and her tears of joy touched his eyes, so he was able to see again...

fields.subtitle: Once upon a time...
fields.name: Rumpelstiltskin
fields.detail_text: The king would marry the miller’s beautiful daughter, if she could spin a room full of straw into gold. An ugly little dwarf helped her, in exchange for her first baby. And so it came about! But then the dwarf felt sorry for the queen: if she could guess his name within three days, she could keep her child. The queen sent out all her servants to collect names. On the third day, one of them spied on the ugly dwarf as he sang: “Tomorrow the royal child I claim, no-one knows Rumpelstiltskin is my name...”

fields.subtitle: Once upon a time...
fields.name: The Red Shoes
fields.detail_text: A poor orphan girl was given shelter by a kind old lady, who looked after her so well that she became vain and spoilt. One day, the old lady became very ill, but, not caring, the girl went to the dance wearing her new red shoes. She danced all evening, having a wonderful time, until she thought of the old lady. She was deeply ashamed and wanted to stop dancing, but the red shoes refused and the girl had to continue dancing all night! Exhausted and very sad, the girl met an old, bearded soldier who felt sorry for her and cut the shoes from her feet with his sword. Now free, the red shoes danced on alone, through the streets, out of the town...

fields.subtitle: Once upon a time...
fields.name: Little Red Riding Hood
fields.detail_text: “Stay on the path and it will take you straight to grandma’s house,” said Little red riding hood‘s mother. But the forest flowers were so pretty, she had to pick some for her sick grandmother. Suddenly, a big wolf jumped out in front of her. Little red riding hood was not afraid and told him about her grandmother. The wolf, who was peckish, ran to grandma’s house and swallowed her whole. When Little red riding hood arrived, she thought grandma looked a little peculiar. Such big ears and big hands and terribly large teeth...

fields.subtitle: Once upon a time...
fields.name: Snow White
fields.detail_text: ‘You, my queen, are fair, it’s true. But dear Snow White is a thousand times fairer than you,’ replied the enchanted mirror. The queen seethed with rage! Her stepdaughter was still alive and more beautiful than her. She swore revenge and disguised herself as an old apple seller with shiny red apples. When Snow White tasted the poisoned apple, she immediately fell to the ground. The dwarves were terribly upset and placed their beloved Snow White in a glass case on the moss. But one day a young prince rode past their house...

fields.subtitle: Once upon a time...
fields.name: Fairytale Tree
fields.detail_text: Meet and greet Fairytale Tree in real life in Efteling’s Fairytale Forest. Together with Woodpecker, Squirrel and Rabbit, he describes an adventure especially chosen by you, featuring your favourite Inhabitant of the Fairytale Forest.

fields.subtitle: Once upon a time...
fields.name: The Troll King
fields.detail_text: The wise troll king sits in his hollow tree and knows everything. He can predict the future of anyone who visits him. And sometimes he gives the future a helping hand. When the wicked Kobold kidnapped princess Clarissa to make her his bride, the troll king sent the young troll Tore after her. Following the good advice of the troll king and with the help of the brave prince Jasper, Tore managed to free the princess and dealt with Kobold. Prince Jasper and princess Clarissa married and lived happily ever after.

fields.subtitle: Once upon a time...
fields.name: Mother Holle
fields.detail_text: The industrious daughter fell into the well and found herself in the amazing land of Mother Holle. “If you will do all housework properly,” said Mother Holle, “you can stay with me. But you must take care to make my bed well, and shake it thoroughly till the feathers fly – for then there will be snow on the earth.” To thank the maiden for her industriousness, Mother Holle showered her with pure gold! The lazy daughter became jealous and jumped into the well, too. But she was lazy and did not shake Mother Holle’s bed. So her reward was to be covered in pitch.

fields.subtitle: Once upon a time...
fields.name: The Six Servants
fields.detail_text: Every prince who asked for the hand of the beautiful princess was set incredibly difficult tasks by the evil queen. The poor princes always ended up losing their heads - literally... When yet another prince arrived at the castle, the queen thought up three impossible tasks. She had not taken into account the prince’s six servants: ‘Hill Belly’, ‘Big Ear’, ‘Spring Legs’, ‘Goose Bumps’, ‘Bullet Eye’, and ‘Long Neck’. With their unusual talents, the tasks were just a piece of cake...

fields.name: Eigenheymer
fields.detail_text: Take away. A delicious fried potato snack seasoned with your choice of spices.

fields.name: Unox stall
fields.detail_text: Take away. Typically Dutch Unox hot dog with a smoked sausage and special Unox sauce. A vegetarian hot dog is also available.

fields.name: Winter drinks and delicacies around the bonfire
fields.detail_text: Warm yourself up at the bonfires while sipping on your warm winter special, a coffee- or Chocomel specials. You can also go there for winter delicacies.
